alert.note: Alert for Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 7:13AM CST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Houston County in southeastern Alabama, Miller, western Dougherty, southeastern Clay, southeastern Randolph, Lee, northwestern Baker, Calhoun, Early, northern Seminole and Terrell Counties in southwestern Georgia through 900 AM EST/800 AM CST/... At 812 AM EST/712 AM CST/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Plains to near Cottonwood. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Colquitt, Cottonwood, Morgan, Albany, Blakely, Dawson, Donalsonville, Leesburg, Ashford, Edison, Arlington, Shellman, Columbia, Leary, Smithville, Walker, Douglasville, Centerville, Avon and Madrid. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until noon EST/1100 AM CST/ for southeastern Alabama...the Panhandle of Florida...and south central and southwestern Georgia.
